Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black, with two pairs of lines in added white; at bottom, part of white pomegranate chain; exterior: four bands, fired light brown; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Names in Ermokt- are not otherwise attested, and so the final tau could have been written in error for rho. Ermokrates is found elsewhere as a dedicator at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 719, pl. XXI, no. 719)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 370, pl. 20.20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0772) (phase 2)
